questions.question: What company is this presentation about?
questions.reference_answer: Edison (Edison EDF Group)

questions.question: What was the total power demand in TWh for FY2023?
What was the percentage change in Italian power demand between FY2022 and FY2023?
What was the thermoelectric production value in TWh for both FY2023 and FY2022?
questions.reference_answer: 14.2 TWh in FY2023 and 15.7 TWh in FY2022

questions.question: What do the green and red bars at the top left represent?
questions.reference_answer: They represent Italy (green bar) and another country (red bar), likely showing the geographic scope of the data

questions.question: What does the lightning bolt symbol on the right side of the slide indicate?
questions.reference_answer: It indicates power/electricity, reinforcing the topic of power generation and distribution

questions.question: According to the bullet points, what two factors contributed to renewables covering 30% of demand?
questions.reference_answer: Improved hydro production thanks to stronger rainfall and growth in PV and wind generation supported by growth in installed capacity

questions.question: What was the reason for lower thermo production according to the presentation?
questions.reference_answer: Lower thermo production (-17.4%) was due to higher imports

questions.question: How many different colored segments are used in each stacked bar chart for Sources and Uses?
questions.reference_answer: 5 colored segments in each stacked bar chart

questions.question: What color is used to represent Wind & other renewables production in the Sources chart?
questions.reference_answer: Green

questions.question: How many direct employees does SSE have?
questions.reference_answer: c14,000 direct employees

questions.question: What is the dividend (full year) shown in the value section?
questions.reference_answer: 60p dividend (full year)

questions.question: What are the two types of SSE businesses under the Renewables category?
questions.reference_answer: SSE Renewables (Providing clean and affordable home-grown energy) and SSE Thermal (Balancing the market with flexible generation)

questions.question: How much investment was made in net zero infrastructure and how many customers were served?
questions.reference_answer: £2.5bn investment in net zero infrastructure and c5m customers served (Networked and supply)

questions.question: What do the circular icons with letters (A, B, C, D) represent in the business model sections?
questions.reference_answer: They appear to be classification or category markers for different business segments within SSE's structure

questions.question: What does the circular diagram in the center with 'Develop', 'Build', 'Invest', and 'Operate' represent?
questions.reference_answer: It represents SSE's business cycle showing how they develop, build, invest in, and operate their assets

questions.question: According to the business model flow, what is the relationship between SSE's development activities and achieving net zero?
questions.reference_answer: SSE drives progress towards net zero by developing, building, operating and investing in clean, secure and affordable electricity infrastructure needed for the energy system of tomorrow

questions.question: What type of businesses are classified as 'economically-regulated' versus 'market-based' in SSE's portfolio?
questions.reference_answer: SSEN Transmission and SSEN Distribution are economically-regulated businesses (Networks), while SSE Renewables, SSE Thermal, SSE Enterprise, and SSE Energy Markets are market-based businesses

questions.question: What are the specific colors used to differentiate between the Renewables, Flexibility, and Networks business segments?
questions.reference_answer: Renewables uses teal/turquoise, Flexibility uses lighter teal/aqua, and Networks uses dark blue/navy

questions.question: How many distinct photographic images are shown in 'The value we create' section on the right side of the document?
questions.reference_answer: Six photographic images are shown in the value creation section

questions.question: What is the page number shown at the top of the image?
Who is the author listed at the top of the page?
questions.reference_answer: Eric Werner

questions.question: In Figure 7, what formula is given for the total number of cells after n rounds when n > k?
questions.reference_answer: Cells(n,k) = 2^k × (n - k + 2)

questions.question: According to Figure 8, what type of cells does the linear stem cell network ultimately produce n × 2^k of?
questions.reference_answer: Terminal cells of type B

questions.question: What do the curved arrows labeled with α (alpha) represent in both network diagrams?
questions.reference_answer: They represent self-renewal loops where cells divide to produce identical daughter cells

questions.question: What is the meaning of the dotted line segment between A2 and Ak-1 in both figures?
questions.reference_answer: It indicates continuation of the pattern - there are more cells in the sequence between A2 and Ak-1 that are not shown

questions.question: In Figure 7's network, what happens to the B stem cells after n rounds of division?
questions.reference_answer: The B stem cells are controlled by a linear stem cell sub-network that maintains a constant 2^k of linear stem cells of type B

questions.question: Based on Figure 8, what is the relationship between the AL stem cell and the Ak cell?
questions.reference_answer: The AL stem cell is the founder cell that initiates the linear stem cell network, while Ak is the last cell in the chain that produces type B cells

questions.question: How many different colors are used to represent cells in Figure 7, and what are they?
questions.reference_answer: Three colors: red (for A cells and stem cells), blue (for B and C cells), and white/unfilled circles for self-renewal loops

questions.question: In Figure 8, how many self-renewal loops (α arrows) are shown explicitly before the dotted continuation?
questions.reference_answer: Three self-renewal loops are shown explicitly (α0 on AL, α1 on A0, and α2 on A1)

questions.question: What is the title of the roadmap shown in the image?
questions.reference_answer: Your Copilot adoption roadmap

questions.question: What is the name of Phase 3?
questions.reference_answer: Deliver impact

questions.question: What are the two steps included in Phase 1 (Get ready)?
questions.reference_answer: Step 1: Review your security and data settings, and Step 3: Create an AI council

questions.question: Which phase includes Step 6 and what is that step about?
questions.reference_answer: Phase 2 (Onboard and engage) includes Step 6: Identify champions to lead the way

questions.question: What does the horizontal navigation bar at the top of the image represent?
questions.reference_answer: It represents the same phases as a navigation menu with tabs: Introduction, Get ready, Onboard and engage, Deliver impact, Extend and optimize, and Next steps

questions.question: What is the purpose of the subtitle text under each phase title?
questions.reference_answer: The subtitle text provides a brief description of what each phase focuses on (e.g., 'Preparing your business for AI' for Phase 1)

questions.question: Based on the roadmap sequence, what foundational work must be completed before you can start tracking progress and business results?
questions.reference_answer: You must complete Phase 1 (Get ready - preparing your business for AI) and Phase 2 (Onboard and engage - accelerating usage and engagement) before moving to Phase 3 where you track progress and business results

questions.question: According to the roadmap progression, at what point does the focus shift from internal preparation to measuring actual business outcomes?
questions.reference_answer: The focus shifts from internal preparation to measuring business outcomes at Phase 3 (Deliver impact), which focuses on 'Tracking progress and business results'

questions.question: What are the exact colors used for each of the four main phase boxes from left to right?
questions.reference_answer: Blue (Phase 1), Teal/Cyan (Phase 2), Pink/Magenta (Phase 3), and Peach/Light Orange (Phase 4)

questions.question: How many total numbered steps are visible across all phases in the roadmap?
questions.reference_answer: 12 steps total (Steps 1-4 in Phase 1, Steps 5-7 in Phase 2, Steps 8-10 in Phase 3, and Steps 11-12 in Phase 4)

questions.question: What is the title of this infographic?
questions.reference_answer: Rent Prices AROUND THE WORLD

questions.question: What is the data source mentioned at the bottom of the image?
questions.reference_answer: Numbeo via Deutsche Bank

questions.question: What is the rent price difference between New York and San Francisco?
questions.reference_answer: $371 (New York: $5,211, San Francisco: $4,840)

questions.question: Which two cities in Asia have rent prices of exactly $1,200?
questions.reference_answer: Jakarta and Taipei

questions.question: What do the different colored regions on the world maps represent?
questions.reference_answer: They represent different continents/regions: North America (blue), South America (green), Asia (pink), Europe (light blue), and Australia (orange)

questions.question: What visual element is used to display the rent prices for each city?
questions.reference_answer: Radiating lines/bars extending from each continental region with city names and prices

questions.question: Based on the data shown, which continent has the highest concentration of cities with rent above $3,000?
questions.reference_answer: North America, with 5 cities above $3,000 (New York, Boston, San Francisco, Chicago, LA)

questions.question: According to the subtitle, what type of apartment does this rent data represent?
questions.reference_answer: Monthly rent for a 1-bedroom apartment in the city center (USD)

questions.question: How many cities are displayed for the European continent section?
questions.reference_answer: 20 cities

questions.question: What color are the dots/circles next to each city name in the infographic?
questions.reference_answer: Various colors including white, pink, and gray dots
